summary: This is an email chain between defense attorney Bruce Barket and prosecutors regarding discovery requests in the case of Nicholas Tartaglione, who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC). The correspondence discusses requests to view surveillance video and forensic reports related to an incident in the cell on July 23, 2019, and the discovery of a contraband cellphone.

connections.description: Bruce Barket is the defense attorney representing Nicholas Tartaglione, as evidenced by his advocacy in discovery requests.
They were cellmates at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC), as referenced by the 'Tartaglione/Epstein cell'.
They are on opposing sides of a legal case, corresponding about discovery and potential court hearings.

events.title: Incident in Tartaglione/Epstein Cell
events.description: An incident occurred in the shared cell of Nicholas Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein at MCC, involving a 'makeshift rope'. Surveillance video and photographs were taken.

keyFacts: The email chain is about discovery requests related to Nicholas Tartaglione, who was Jeffrey Epstein's cellmate at MCC.
A key subject is an incident on July 23, 2019, in the shared cell, involving a 'makeshift rope' and surveillance video.
The defense is seeking to view a 5-hour long surveillance video related to the July 23 incident and is considering requesting a court hearing about it.
The Bureau of Prisons (BOP) created forensic reports of a contraband cellphone belonging to Tartaglione, which are subject to privilege review.
Prosecutors state that apart from already provided photographs, no other pictures or videos were taken from inside the Tartaglione/Epstein cell on the night of July 23.
